tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Piano Group: Mixed-stage 3RACE 3-UTR 454 sequencing (alignments)
tracks.label: large RACE products -pool H (bigwig)

metadata.citation:
Mixed-stage 3'RACE 454 sequencing & alignment (Piano project, Piano subgroup)

General Description

The 3' untranslated region (3'UTR) constitutes a major site of post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression. Sequence elements in the 3'UTR interact with trans-acting regulators such as microRNAs that affect translation and stability. The overall aim is to use a 3'RACE cloning-sequencing stragety to identify the 3'UTRs of C. elegans transcripts and explore their heterogeneity in different developmental stages and tissues.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: Single colony DNA extraction
  2. Sample preparation: Single colony DNA extraction, 454 sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: 454 Data Processing
  1. External Links: GSM469976

Related modENCODE submissions:

  • DCC-2501: 3' UTRome 454 sample pools

Release Date: 2009-11-16

tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Waterston Group:RNA-Seq: polyA RNA reads
tracks.label: mid-L4 25dC 36hrs

metadata.citation:
C. elegans mid-L4 N2 RNA-Seq sequences and alignments (Waterston project, Waterston subgroup)

Details

Using polyA+ RNA isolated from C. elegans N2 L4 larva, we prepared and sheared double-stranded cDNA. A ~200 bp fraction was isolated and used to generate libraries for massively parallel sequencing on the Illumina instrument (36 bp reads). Using maq and cross_match, we aligned the reads to the genome and to splice junction and splice leader databases. Raw alignments show positions of uniquely mapping reads. Raw coverage files represent depth of coverage of read alignments. Windowed coverage represents the sum of the read coverage in a 51bp window surrounding each base.

Series Description

Using massively parallel sequencing by synthesis methods, we are surveying transcripts from various stages, tissues and conditions of the nematode C. elegans. We use novel statistical approaches to evaluate coverage of annotated features of the genome and of candidate processed transcripts. We then provide lists of evidence of level of expression per transcript and catalogs of confirmed splice junctions, trans-spliced leader sequences, start sites, end sites, and poly-adenylation tracts for each stage/tissue/condition.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: Worm_growth, Staging_and_isolation, RNA_isolation
  2. Sample preparation: Sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: Alignment
  1. Growth Conditions: 25 degrees celsius

Sample Details

  1. Animals/Lines: mid-L4, N2
  2. External Links: SRX001874


Release Date: 2009-11-20

tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Waterston Group:RNA-Seq: small ncRNA reads
tracks.label: Adult spe-9 Day 8 (bigwig)

metadata.citation:
spe-9 adult hermaphrodite 8 days post-L4 small ncRNA RNA-Seq (Waterston project, Slack subgroup)

Details

small RNAs (<200bp) were isolated from spe-9 adults 8 days post-L4, and sequenced using Illumina technology. Sequences were aligned to the WS180 genome using SOAP, and converted to SAM. Alignments were lifted to WS190 coordinates by the DCC.

Series Description

We report a significant number of miRNAs and other non-coding small RNAs show dramatic changes in expression during aging in C. elegans. RNAs were prepared from four diffrent timepoints during adulthood of C. elegans hermaphrodites, Day 0, 5, 8 and 12 post-L4 molt, and used for making cDNA libraries for small RNAs. Each library was sequenced using recent advances in high-throughput sequencing technology, Solexa. This study should lead to a better understanding of the aging process and age-related diseases.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: worm growth, worm staging and isolation, small RNA isolation, cDNA library prep and Illumina sequencing
  2. Data Analysis: SOAP alignment
  1. Growth Conditions: 23 degrees celsius

Sample Details

  1. Animals/Lines: Adult spe-9(hc88) 23dC 8 days post-L4 molt, BA671
  2. External Links: GSM463027, GSM463030


Release Date: 2010-02-13

tracks.label: pool G

metadata.citation:
Mixed-stage 3'RACE Illumina sequencing & alignment (Piano project, Piano subgroup)

Details

Minipools containing 3'UTRs were amplified from mixed-stage N2 animals with target-specific primers. These minipools may contain potentially different 3'UTR isoforms and were generated from cloning 3'RACE products for each targeted gene. Illumina generated sequences were aligned to the WS190 genome using Bowtie.

Series Description

The 3' untranslated region (3'UTR) constitutes a major site of post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression. The overall aim is to use a 3'RACE cloning-sequencing stragety to identify the 3'UTRs of C. elegans transcripts and explore their heterogeneity in different developmental stages and tissues.

metadata.citation:
mid-L3 N2 hermaphrodite small ncRNA RNA-Seq (Waterston project, Slack subgroup)

General Description

We aim to examine the changes in expression of non-coding small RNAs, including miRNAs and piRNAs/21U-RNAs, during development and aging, and in the different sexes of C. elegans using high-throughput sequencing technology Solexa. Additionally, we will identify novel small RNAs, especially novel miRNA candidates.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: worm growth, worm staging and isolation, small RNA isolation
  2. Sample preparation: cDNA library prep and Illumina sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: SOAP alignment

Reagents

  1. Animals: mid-L3 20dC 25hrs post-L1, N2
  2. External Links: GSM336058

Raw coverage files represent depth of coverage of read alignments. Windowed coverage represents the sum of the read coverage in a 51bp window surrounding each base.

General Description

Using massively parallel sequencing by synthesis methods, we are surveying transcripts from various stages, tissues and conditions of the nematode C. elegans. We use novel statistical approaches to evaluate coverage of annotated features of the genome and of candidate processed transcripts. We then provide lists of evidence of level of expression per transcript and catalogs of confirmed splice junctions, trans-spliced leader sequences, start sites, end sites, and poly-adenylation tracts for each stage/tissue/condition.

tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Piano Group: 3RACE polyA-capture 3-UTR 454 alignments
tracks.label: Adult Male

metadata.citation:
3RACE polyA-capture N2 male 454 alignments (Piano project, Kim subgroup)

Details

3UTRs were isolated from male adults of C. elegans N2 worms using a poly-A capturing technique. RNAs were sequenced on the Roche 454 platform. This submission reflects the alignments of the deconvoluted, male adult stage-specific reads to WS190 genome using BLAT.

General Description

The 3 untranslated region (3UTR) constitutes a major site of post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression. Sequence elements in the 3UTR interact with trans-acting regulators such as microRNAs that affect translation and stability. The overall aim is to use a 3RACE cloning-sequencing stragety to identify the 3UTRs of C. elegans transcripts and explore their heterogeneity in different developmental stages and tissues.

Protocols

  1. Data Analysis: BLAT alignment
  1. External Links: GSM446657

  • DCC-2459: 3 UTR Staged 454 Sequencing - male adult - sequences

tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Waterston Group:RNA-Seq: polyA RNA reads
tracks.label: embryo him-8 20dC

metadata.citation:
C. elegans Embryo him-8 RNA-Seq sequences and alignments (Waterston project, Waterston subgroup)

Details

Using polyA+ RNA isolated from C. elegans him-8 embryos, we prepared and sheared double-stranded cDNA. A ~200 bp fraction was isolated and used to generate libraries for massively parallel sequencing on the Illumina instrument (36 bp reads). Using maq and cross_match, we aligned the reads to the genome and to splice junction and splice leader databases. Raw alignments show positions of uniquely mapping reads. Raw coverage files represent depth of coverage of read alignments. Windowed coverage represents the sum of the read coverage in a 51bp window surrounding each base.

Series Description

Using massively parallel sequencing by synthesis methods, we are surveying transcripts from various stages, tissues and conditions of the nematode C. elegans. We use novel statistical approaches to evaluate coverage of annotated features of the genome and of candidate processed transcripts. We then provide lists of evidence of level of expression per transcript and catalogs of confirmed splice junctions, trans-spliced leader sequences, start sites, end sites, and poly-adenylation tracts for each stage/tissue/condition.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: Worm_growth, Staging_and_isolation, RNA_isolation
  2. Sample preparation: Sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: Alignment
  1. Growth Conditions: 20 degrees celsius

Sample Details

  1. Animals/Lines: embryo him-8(e1480) 20dC, CB1489
  2. External Links: SRX011569

tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Waterston Group:RNA-Seq: small ncRNA reads
tracks.label: Adult spe-9 Day 0

metadata.citation:
spe-9 adult hermaphrodite 0days post-L4 small ncRNA RNA-Seq (Waterston project, Slack subgroup)

Details

small RNAs (<200bp) were isolated from spe-9 adults 5 days post-L4, and sequenced using Illumina technology. Sequences were aligned to the WS180 genome using SOAP, and converted to SAM. Alignments were lifted to WS190 coordinates by the DCC.

General Description

We report a significant number of miRNAs and other non-coding small RNAs show dramatic changes in expression during aging in C. elegans. RNAs were prepared from four diffrent timepoints during adulthood of C. elegans hermaphrodites, Day 0, 5, 8 and 12 post-L4 molt, and used for making cDNA libraries for small RNAs. Each library was sequenced using recent advances in high-throughput sequencing technology, Solexa. This study should lead to a better understanding of the aging process and age-related diseases.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: worm growth, worm staging and isolation, small RNA isolation
  2. Data Analysis: SOAP alignment
  3. Other Protocols: cDNA library prep and Illumina sequencing
  1. Growth Conditions: 23C

Sample Details

  1. Animals/Lines: young adult (23dC DAY0 post-L4 molt), BA671
  2. External Links: GSM463025, GSM463029

Additionally, we will identify novel small RNAs, especially novel miRNA candidates.

  2. Sample preparation: cDNA library prep and Illumina sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: SOAP alignment

tracks.key: Adult S.macescens Db10 control exp. OP50 1-24hr
tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Waterston Group:RNA-Seq: polyA RNA reads
tracks.label: Adult S.macescens Db10 control exp. OP50 1-24hr

metadata.citation:
RNA-Seq - pathogen Smacescens control OP50 25dC 24hr exposure post-adulthood N2 sequences & alignments (Waterston project, Waterston subgroup)

Details

Using polyA+ RNA isolated from C. elegans adults (grown as a control for the S. macescens exposure), we prepared and sheared double-stranded cDNA. A ~200 bp fraction was isolated and used to generate libraries for massively parallel sequencing on the Illumina instrument (36 bp reads). Using maq and cross_match, we aligned the reads to the genome and to splice junction and splice leader databases. Raw alignments show positions of uniquely mapping reads. Raw coverage files represent depth of coverage of read alignments. Windowed coverage represents the sum of the read coverage in a 51bp window surrounding each base.

General Description

Using massively parallel sequencing by synthesis methods, we are surveying transcripts from various stages, tissues and conditions of the nematode C. elegans. We use novel statistical approaches to evaluate coverage of annotated features of the genome and of candidate processed transcripts. We then provide lists of evidence of level of expression per transcript and catalogs of confirmed splice junctions, trans-spliced leader sequences, start sites, end sites, and poly-adenylation tracts for each stage/tissue/condition.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: Worm_growth, Staging_and_isolation, Growth_condition_assay, RNA_isolation
  2. Sample preparation: Sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: Alignment
  1. Growth Conditions: 25 degrees celsius, E. coli (OP50)

Sample Details

  1. Animals/Lines: Young Adult, N2
  2. External Links: SRX014009


Release Date: 2010-02-02

tracks.label: embryo N2 hermaphrodite (bigwig)

metadata.citation:
embryo N2 hermaphrodite small ncRNA RNA-Seq (Waterston project, Slack subgroup)

General Description

We aim to examine the changes in expression of non-coding small RNAs, including miRNAs and piRNAs/21U-RNAs, during development and aging, and in the different sexes of C. elegans using high-throughput sequencing technology Solexa. Additionally, we will identify novel small RNAs, especially novel miRNA candidates.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: worm growth, worm staging and isolation, small RNA isolation
  2. Sample preparation: cDNA library prep and Illumina sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: SOAP alignment

A ~200 bp fraction was isolated and used to generate libraries for massively parallel sequencing on the Illumina instrument (36 bp reads). Using maq and cross_match, we aligned the reads to the WS170 genome and to splice junction and splice leader databases. Raw alignments show positions of uniquely mapping reads. Raw coverage files represent depth of coverage of read alignments. Windowed coverage represents the sum of the read coverage in a 51bp window surrounding each base. Alignments and coverage files were lifted over to WS190 coordinates by the DCC for display in the browser.

General Description

Using massively parallel sequencing by synthesis methods, we are surveying transcripts from various stages, tissues and conditions of the nematode C. elegans. We use novel statistical approaches to evaluate coverage of annotated features of the genome and of candidate processed transcripts. We then provide lists of evidence of level of expression per transcript and catalogs of confirmed splice junctions, trans-spliced leader sequences, start sites, end sites, and poly-adenylation tracts for each stage/tissue/condition.

Protocols

  1. Growth and isolation: Worm_growth, Staging_and_isolation, RNA_isolation
  2. Sample preparation: Sequencing
  3. Data Analysis: Alignment
  1. Growth Conditions: 25 degrees celsius

Sample Details

  1. Animals/Lines: early embryo, N2
  2. External Links: SRX004863, SRX004864

tracks.category: modENCODE Tracks : Piano Group: 3RACE polyA-capture 3-UTR 454 sequencing pilot (alignments)
tracks.label: L1(3RACE pilot)

metadata.citation:
3RACE polyA-capture N2 emb-thru-adult 454 alignments pilot (Piano project, Kim subgroup)

Details

In this pilot study, 3UTRs were isolated from specific stages of C. elegans N2 worms, including embryos, L1, L2, L3, and L4 larva, and adults, and RNA isolated using a poly-A capturing technique. RNAs were barcoded, mixed together, and amplified, prior to sequencing on the Roche 454 platform. This submission reflects the alignments of the deconvoluted, stage-specific reads to WS190 genome using BLAT.

General Description

The 3 untranslated region (3UTR) constitutes a major site of post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression. Sequence elements in the 3UTR interact with trans-acting regulators such as microRNAs that affect translation and stability. The overall aim is to use a 3RACE cloning-sequencing stragety to identify the 3UTRs of C. elegans transcripts and explore their heterogeneity in different developmental stages and tissues.

Protocols

  1. Data Analysis: BLAT alignment
  1. External Links: GSM443959, GSM443960, GSM443961, GSM443962, GSM443963

Related modENCODE submissions:

  • DCC-896: 3UTR 454 sequencing pilot - Level 1

Release Date: 2009-11-04

metadata.citation:
C. elegans mid-L4 N2 RNA-Seq sequences and alignments (Waterston project, Waterston subgroup)

Details

Using polyA+ RNA isolated from C. elegans N2 L4 larva, we prepared and sheared double-stranded cDNA. A ~200 bp fraction was isolated and used to generate libraries for massively parallel sequencing on the Illumina instrument (36 bp reads). Using maq and cross_match, we aligned the reads to the genome and to splice junction and splice leader databases. Raw alignments show positions of uniquely mapping reads. Raw coverage files represent depth of coverage of read alignments. Windowed coverage represents the sum of the read coverage in a 51bp window surrounding each base.

Series Description

Using massively parallel sequencing by synthesis methods, we are surveying transcripts from various stages, tissues and conditions of the nematode C. elegans. We use novel statistical approaches to evaluate coverage of annotated features of the genome and of candidate processed transcripts. We then provide lists of evidence of level of expression per transcript and catalogs of confirmed splice junctions, trans-spliced leader sequences, start sites, end sites, and poly-adenylation tracts for each stage/tissue/condition.

  2. Sample preparation: Sequencing
